proverb: قطره قطره دریا می‌شود
transliteration: Qatra qatra darya me-shawad
translation: Drop by drop, a river is made.
meaning: Small efforts accumulate to create significant outcomes.

proverb: هیچ گل بی خار نیست
transliteration: Heech gul bey khaar neest
translation: There is no flower without thorns.
meaning: Nothing is perfect; everything has its flaws.

proverb: دروغ‌گو حافظه ندارد
transliteration: Doroogh-go haafeza nadaarad
translation: A liar has no memory.
meaning: Liars can't keep track of their lies.

proverb: جوینده یابنده است
transliteration: Joyenda yaabenda ast
translation: The seeker is the finder.
meaning: Persistence leads to success.

proverb: دو تربوز به یک دست گرفته نمی‌شود
transliteration: Do tarbooz ba yak dast gerefta nemi-shawad
translation: You can't hold two watermelons in one hand.
meaning: You can't pursue two goals at once without compromising.

proverb: سیلی نقد بهتر از حلوای نسیه است
transliteration: Sile naqhd behtar az halwai nasia ast
translation: A slap in cash is better than sweet on credit.
meaning: A certain but harsh truth is better than a sweet promise.

proverb: گربه برای رضای خدا موش نمی‌گیرد
transliteration: Gorba barā-ye rezā-ye Khodā moosh na-megīrad
translation: The cat doesn't catch mice for God's pleasure.
meaning: People usually act out of self-interest.

proverb: مار گزیده از ریسمان سیاه و سفید می‌ترسد
transliteration: Mār gazida az resmān-e siyāh wa sefid mi-tarsad
translation: A snake-bitten person fears even a black and white rope.
meaning: One who has suffered is easily frightened again.

proverb: آب که از سر گذشت، چه یک نی چه صد نی
transliteration: Āb ke az sar gozasht, che yak ney che sad ney
translation: Once the water passes the head, one reed or a hundred doesn't matter.
meaning: When something is ruined, more damage makes no difference.

proverb: هر که بامش بیش برفش بیشتر
transliteration: Har ke bāmash bīsh, barfash bīsh-tar
translation: He who has a bigger roof, gets more snow.
meaning: With greater wealth or status come more responsibilities.

proverb: از دل برود آنچه از دیده برود
transliteration: Az dil berawad ān che az dīde berawad
translation: Out of sight, out of mind.
meaning: What you don't see, you forget.

proverb: دوستی که در سختی به یاری نیاید، در خوشی به چهارایی می‌آید
transliteration: Dosti ke dar sakhti be yāri nayāyad, dar khushi be chahārāyi miāyad
translation: A friend who doesn't help in hardship will come to enjoy in happiness.
meaning: True friends are those who support you in tough times.

proverb: کار امروز را به فردا مسپار
transliteration: Kār-e emrooz rā ba fardā maspār
translation: Don’t leave today’s work for tomorrow.
meaning: Avoid procrastination; do your work now.

proverb: باد آورده را باد می‌برد
transliteration: Bād āwarda rā bād mibarad
translation: What the wind brings, the wind can take away.
meaning: Easy come, easy go.

proverb: هر که خربوزه می‌خورد، پای لرزش هم باید بنشیند
transliteration: Har ke kharboza mekhorad, pāy-e larzesh ham bāyad beneshinad
translation: Whoever eats the melon must endure its trembling.
meaning: You must accept the consequences of your choices.

proverb: یک کلاغ، چهل کلاغ می‌شود
transliteration: Yak kalāgh, chehel kalāgh mishawad
translation: One crow becomes forty crows.
meaning: Rumors and stories tend to exaggerate over time.

proverb: چراغی که به خانه رواست، به مسجد حرام است
transliteration: Cherāghi ke ba khāna rawāst, ba masjed harām ast
translation: A lamp needed at home is forbidden for the mosque.
meaning: Charity begins at home.

proverb: هر چه کنی به خود کنی، گر همه نیک و بد کنی
transliteration: Har che kuni ba khod kuni, gar hama neek o bad kuni
translation: Whatever you do, you do to yourself — good or bad.
meaning: Your actions have consequences for you.

proverb: دزد با چراغ آید، گزیده‌تر برد کالا
transliteration: Dozd bā cherāgh āyad, gazida-tar barad kālā
translation: The thief comes with a lamp — chooses the best goods.
meaning: The most dangerous people are those who appear wise or prepared.

proverb: شتر در خواب بیند پنبه دانه
transliteration: Shotor dar khwāb bīnad panba dāna
translation: The camel dreams of cotton seeds.
meaning: Wishful thinking won’t make dreams come true.

proverb: آب در کوزه و ما تشنه لبانیم
transliteration: Āb dar kuze wa mā tashna labānīm
translation: Water is in the pitcher, and we are thirsty.
meaning: Sometimes the solution is right in front of us, yet we fail to see it.

proverb: هر که درختی بکارد، سایه‌اش را درو می‌کند
transliteration: Har ke derakhti bokārad, sāye-ash rā daru mikonad
translation: Whoever plants a tree will harvest its shade.
meaning: Your efforts will yield benefits in the future.

proverb: دیگ به دیگ می‌گوید رویت سیاه
transliteration: Deg ba deg mīguyad rooyat siyāh
translation: The pot says to the kettle: your face is black.
meaning: People criticize others for flaws they also have.

proverb: گندم از گندم بروید، جو ز جو
transliteration: Gandum az gandum barāyad, jaw ze jaw
translation: Wheat grows from wheat, barley from barley.
meaning: You reap what you sow.

proverb: با یک گل بهار نمی‌شود
transliteration: Bā yak gul bahār nemishawad
translation: One flower does not make a spring.
meaning: One good deed or person isn't enough to create change.

proverb: هر گلی خاری دارد
transliteration: Har guli khāri dārad
translation: Every rose has its thorn.
meaning: Nothing is perfect — beauty comes with challenges.

proverb: دل به دل راه دارد
transliteration: Del ba del rāh dārad
translation: There is a way from heart to heart.
meaning: True feelings are mutually understood without words.

proverb: مرغ همسایه غاز است
transliteration: Morgh-e hamsāya ghāz ast
translation: The neighbor’s chicken is a goose.
meaning: Other people’s possessions often seem better.

proverb: سنگ بزرگ علامت نزدن است
transliteration: Sang-e bozorg alāmat-e nazadan ast
translation: A big stone means you won’t throw it.
meaning: Overpromising usually leads to inaction.
